title: Aciagrion approximans
text:
Aciagrion approximans, Indian violet dartlet, is a species of <a href="damselfly">damselfly</a> in the family <a href="Coenagrionidae">Coenagrionidae</a>. It is found in <a href="Northeast%20India">east</a> and <a href="Western%20Ghats">south</a> of <a href="India">India</a>. The range extends to <a href="Thailand">Thailand</a>, <a href="China">China</a> and <a href="Cambodia">Cambodia</a>.
Subspecies.
<a href="Frederic%20Charles%20Fraser">Fraser</a> considered the specimen found in <a href="Northeast%20India">northeast</a> as "Aciagrion approximans" and in <a href="Western%20Ghats">south</a> as "Aciargion hisopa" race "krishna". A recent study revealed that the subspecies "krishna" found in <a href="Western%20Ghats">south</a> is not conspecific with "A. hisopa" and found to be very close to "A. approximans" found in <a href="Northeast%20India">northeast</a>; but differing at the level of subspecies.
Description and habitat.
It is a small, slim, slender damselfly with violet and black colors. Its thorax is black with lateral violet stripes. Segments 2 to 7 of the abdomen are black on dorsum and violet in the ventral half. Segments 8 and 9 are violet without any marks. Segment 10 is black on dorsum. The lower half of segment 8 is marked with black in "A. a. krishna". Female is similar to the male; but paler in colors. Segments 8 and 9 are black and 10 is blue on dorsum.
It breeds in ponds, lakes or in slow moving streams.
